channel.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
channel.description:
topic basically says all. i know other people have posted about it. can someone make a tutorial on how to do it or explain it in depth? please
Thanks, Nick

item.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @nicka22 nicka22
item.description:
@nicka22 wrote:

okay i did what you said correctly and it still wont work for me. i havent compiled it, will it work if i dont compile it??
i did the compile.bat and when i do the run.bat it wont run. it says this crap in the black screen and closes before i can read it. i then had to re-download easyrsc… anyone know why this is happening? if so what do i need to do?

Read full topic
item.source: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!

item.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @NotPro NotPro
item.description:
@NotPro wrote:

[quote=“nicka22, post:8, topic:324106”]okay so notpro i did what u said and it didnt work. but u mentioned something about changing the settings file in my server file… that might be the problem because i never have changed the settings in the server file, but thats because i thought there isnt one??? is there one or is that your goof?
Secondly: do i have to change the port number or anything??
do i need to compile???[/quote]

No, It wasn’t my goof, I told you the server.java file is in your Server/src/org/rscdaemon/server folder then scroll or look down at the bottom of that folder and ther will be a file called server open that and do what I said above and yes compile after you edit the server.java file.

Read full topic

item.source: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!

item.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @NotPro NotPro
item.description:
@NotPro wrote:

[quote=“nicka22, post:6, topic:324106”]okay im having some real troubles, but i know im close. if someone fully answers this i will get it. first question is do i enter my ip address or the hamachi ip address??

Second:do i enter the ip address in both the client and server… not the distributed client? or all 3??

Third: i have tried putting my real ip address in both the client and server part didnt work. i tried putting thie hamachi ip in both the client and the server didnt work. and i put the 0.0.0.0 in the server and client didnt work…

Someone please clean this up for me i know im really close.

Thanks,
Nick[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 14, 2010, 07:22:31 pm[/size][hr]p.s. by didnt work i mean i got the “sorry cannot connect to server”…[/quote]

If you are using hamachi. First go into your client and open the settings and change it to your hamachi ip and do the same for the settings file in your server folder, then go to Server>src>org>rscdaemon>server and open the file called server.java and search for “acceptor.bind(new InetSocketAddress”(without the “”) and put your hamachi ip between the “”.

for example: acceptor.bind(new InetSocketAddress(“127.0.0.1” <—That is localhost which will allow only you to connect, so don’t put that its only a example.

Read full topic

item.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

instead of 127.0.0.1, do 0.0.0.0 so it binds to everything and you can let anyone connect

item.source: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!

item.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Nuk Nuk
item.description:
@Nuk wrote:

nicka22:

Second Question: the server.java part is confusing to me, when i open it it opens in like notepad or word pad or wte, but where do i put the ip in it?? there is no like “server=” as there is in the setting.ini.

K so open up server.java and search

acceptor.bind(new InetSocketAddress("127.0.0.1", GameVars.portNumber), new RSCConnectionHandler(engine), config)
Or then search for 127.0.0.1 or localhost

Read full topic

item.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @nicka22 nicka22
item.description:
@nicka22 wrote:

okay a couple of questions im soo close.

first question: do i put my ip address in or the hamatchi ip address in?? also do i put the same ip in for both the setting.ini and the server.java?

Second Question: the server.java part is confusing to me, when i open it it opens in like notepad or word pad or wte, but where do i put the ip in it?? there is no like “server=” as there is in the setting.ini. do i need to type anything special in the server.java to make it read the ip??? please explain where to enter ip address in the server.java file thanks soo much!!

Read full topic
item.source: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!

item.title: Making server go public so you can play with your friends! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @aaronsc aaronsc
item.description:
@aaronsc wrote:

You’ll need to portforward. If you have a router, go to www.portforward.com it has a guide for almost every router out there. Follow the guide and then you should be good. If not, go to google, and type in “hamachi download for free” download hamachi, usually from logmein. Once download make a network for your server, tell your friends to download hamachi and type in the network name to join. Once they are joined, put your IP into your server.java on the server side, and into your Settings.ini in the client side, give them the client via email or any upload site, and voila! you can play with your friends! hope this helped.

Read full topic
